content.en: Echo cancellation: Researchers have been investigating the performance of various algorithms in the field of acoustic echo cancellation. These algorithms are attributed with the ability to detect and cancel out unwanted noise and echo, enhance echo rejection, provide fast convergence, reduce echo residual, converge faster, bridge performance gaps, achieve fast convergence at low complexity, model loudspeakers and identify impulse responses, provide reduced coupling between subfilters, limit unexpected increases in error-to-reference ratio, solve optimization problems adaptively, achieve high robustness against double talk, reduce computational requirements, provide fast convergence rate and small steady-state mean-square error, provide good anti-windup properties, work well in sparse and dispersive circumstances, obtain fast convergence rate and small steady-state mean-square error, enhance filter estimation error, provide efficient control of update sequences, cope with nonlinear distortions, and efficiently handle single-channel acoustic echo cancellation.
content.da: Ekkoundertrykkelse: Forskere har undersøgt ydeevnen af forskellige algoritmer inden for akustisk ekkoundertrykkelse. Disse algoritmer er kendt for deres evne til at opdage og eliminere uønsket støj og ekko, forbedre ekkoafvisning, give hurtig konvergens, reducere ekko- residual, konvergere hurtigere, bygge bro over ydeevnekløfter, opnå hurtig konvergens ved lav kompleksitet, modellere højttalere og identificere impulssvar, give reduceret kobling mellem subfiltre, begrænse uventede stigninger i fejl-til-reference-forhold, løse optimeringsproblemer adaptivt, opnå høj robusthed mod dobbelt tale, reducere beregningskrav, give hurtig konvergensrate og lille steady-state middelkvadreret fejl, give gode anti-windup egenskaber, fungere godt i spredte og dispersive omstændigheder, opnå hurtig konvergensrate og lille steady-state middelkvadreret fejl, forbedre filterestimeringsfejl, give effektiv kontrol af opdateringssekvenser, håndtere ikke-lineære forvrængninger og effektivt håndtere enkeltkanals akustisk ekkoundertrykkelse.
